sn46.76:1.1: “Mendicants, when the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
sn46.76:1.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the perception of cessation together with the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.76:1.4: That’s how, when the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated, it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
sn46.76:2.1: When the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated you can expect one of two results:
sn46.76:2.2: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.
sn46.76:2.5: It’s when a mendicant develops the perception of cessation together with the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.76:2.6: When the perception of cessation is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect one of two results:
sn46.76:2.7: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
sn46.76:3.1: “The perception of cessation, when developed and cultivated, leads to great benefit … great sanctuary … great inspiration … great ease.
sn46.76:3.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the perception of cessation together with the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn46.76:3.4: That’s how the perception of cessation, when developed and cultivated, leads to great benefit … great sanctuary … great inspiration … great ease.”
